aims: This unit is for students to develop themselves through a better understanding of the theories important to engineering leadership and management practice. The focus of the unit is to integrate leadership and management theory and practice in the context of the real life professional engineering role in organisational and industrial settings.
intended learning outcomes: Apply management skills needed by engineers to develop and manage the implementation of solutions
Iidentify the consequences of the above solutions and their implementation on the financial, physical and human resources of an organisation
Apply engineering professional and management skills, such as communication, negotiation, staff motivation and development and performance management, to execute the above solutions.
